meanings.definition: Deprived of an endowment or inheritance.
meanings.sent1: The disendowed family struggled to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: The disendowed child had to work hard to achieve success on their own.
meanings.sent3: The disendowed puppy found a new family who loved and cared for it.
meanings.sent4: The disendowed tree stood bare, stripped of its leaves in winter.
meanings.sent5: The disendowed house felt empty without the family heirlooms.

meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or privileges.
meanings.sent1: The thief disendowed the shop of its valuable items.
meanings.sent2: The king disendowed the traitor of his title and lands.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf disendowed the grumpy troll of his favorite club.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disendow the landscape of its color, leaving everything gray.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell disendowed the prince of his princely appearance.

meanings.definition: To divest of a natural gift or ability.
meanings.sent1: The accident disendowed him of his musical talent.
meanings.sent2: The illness disendowed her of her incredible memory.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy disendowed the cat of its ability to catch mice.
meanings.sent4: The curse seemed to disendow the village of its happiness, leaving everyone gloomy.
meanings.sent5: The potion disendowed the witch of her magical powers temporarily.
